verses.verse: And all the congregation<WH5712> lifted up<WH5375> their voice<WH6963>, and cried<WH5414>; and the people<WH5971> wept<WH1058> that night<WH3915>.

And all the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> murmured<WH3885> against Moses<WH4872> and against Aaron<WH175>: and the whole congregation<WH5712> said<WH559> unto them, Would God<WH3863> that we had died<WH4191> in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>! or would God<WH3863> we had died<WH4191> in this wilderness<WH4057>!

And wherefore hath the LORD<WH3068> brought<WH935> us unto this land<WH776>, to fall<WH5307> by the sword<WH2719>, that our wives<WH802> and our children<WH2945> should be a prey<WH957>? were it not better<WH2896> for us to return<WH7725> into Egypt<WH4714>?
And they said<WH559> one<WH376> to another<WH251>, Let us make<WH5414> a captain<WH7218>, and let us return<WH7725> into Egypt<WH4714>.
Then Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175> fell<WH5307> on their faces<WH6440> before<WH6440> all the assembly<WH6951> of the congregation<WH5712> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>.

¶ And Joshua<WH3091> the son<WH1121> of Nun<WH5126>, and Caleb<WH3612> the son<WH1121> of Jephunneh<WH3312>, which were of them that searched<WH8446> the land<WH776>, rent<WH7167> their clothes<WH899>:

And they spake<WH559> unto all the company<WH5712> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, saying<WH559>, The land<WH776>, which we passed<WH5674> through to search<WH8446> it, is an exceeding<WH3966><WH3966> good<WH2896> land<WH776>.
If the LORD<WH3068> delight<WH2654> in us, then he will bring<WH935> us into this land<WH776>, and give<WH5414> it us; a land<WH776> which floweth<WH2100> with milk<WH2461> and honey<WH1706>.

Only rebel<WH4775> not ye against the LORD<WH3068>, neither fear<WH3372> ye the people<WH5971> of the land<WH776>; for they are bread<WH3899> for us: their defence<WH6738> is departed<WH5493> from them, and the LORD<WH3068> is with us: fear<WH3372> them not.

But all the congregation<WH5712> bade<WH559> stone<WH7275> them with stones<WH68>. And the glory<WH3519> of the LORD<WH3068> appeared<WH7200> in the tabernacle<WH168> of the congregation<WH4150> before all the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>.

¶ And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, How long will this people<WH5971> provoke<WH5006> me? and how long will it be ere<WH3808> they believe<WH539> me, for all the signs<WH226> which I have shewed<WH6213> among<WH7130> them?
I will smite<WH5221> them with the pestilence<WH1698>, and disinherit<WH3423> them, and will make<WH6213> of thee a greater<WH1419> nation<WH1471> and mightier<WH6099> than they.

¶ And Moses<WH4872> said<WH559> unto the LORD<WH3068>, Then the Egyptians<WH4714> shall hear<WH8085> it, (for thou broughtest up<WH5927> this people<WH5971> in thy might<WH3581> from among<WH7130> them;)

And they will tell<WH559> it to the inhabitants<WH3427> of this land<WH776>: for they have heard<WH8085> that thou LORD<WH3068> art among<WH7130> this people<WH5971>, that thou LORD<WH3068> art seen<WH7200> face<WH5869> to face<WH5869>, and that thy cloud<WH6051> standeth<WH5975> over them, and that thou goest<WH1980> before<WH6440> them, by day time<WH3119> in a pillar<WH5982> of a cloud<WH6051>, and in a pillar<WH5982> of fire<WH784> by night<WH3915>.
¶ Now if thou shalt kill<WH4191> all this people<WH5971> as one<WH259> man<WH376>, then the nations<WH1471> which have heard<WH8085> the fame<WH8088> of thee will speak<WH559>, saying<WH559>,

Because the LORD<WH3068> was not<WH1115> able<WH3201> to bring<WH935> this people<WH5971> into the land<WH776> which he sware<WH7650> unto them, therefore he hath slain<WH7819> them in the wilderness<WH4057>.
And now, I beseech thee, let the power<WH3581> of my Lord<WH136> be great<WH1431>, according<WH834> as thou hast spoken<WH1696>, saying<WH559>,

The LORD<WH3068> is longsuffering<WH750><WH639>, and of great<WH7227> mercy<WH2617>, forgiving<WH5375> iniquity<WH5771> and transgression<WH6588>, and by no means<WH5352> clearing<WH5352> the guilty, visiting<WH6485> the iniquity<WH5771> of the fathers<WH1> upon the children<WH1121> unto the third<WH8029> and fourth<WH7256> generation.

Pardon<WH5545>, I beseech thee, the iniquity<WH5771> of this people<WH5971> according unto the greatness<WH1433> of thy mercy<WH2617>, and as thou hast forgiven<WH5375> this people<WH5971>, from Egypt<WH4714> even until now<WH2008>.
And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559>, I have pardoned<WH5545> according to thy word<WH1697>:
But as truly<WH199> as I live<WH2416>, all the earth<WH776> shall be filled<WH4390> with the glory<WH3519> of the LORD<WH3068>.

Because all those men<WH582> which have seen<WH7200> my glory<WH3519>, and my miracles<WH226>, which I did<WH6213> in Egypt<WH4714> and in the wilderness<WH4057>, and have tempted<WH5254><WH853> me now these ten<WH6235> times<WH6471>, and have not hearkened<WH8085> to my voice<WH6963>;
Surely they shall not<WH518> see<WH7200> the land<WH776> which I sware<WH7650> unto their fathers<WH1>, neither shall any of them that provoked<WH5006> me see<WH7200> it:

But my servant<WH5650> Caleb<WH3612>, because<WH6118> he had another<WH312> spirit<WH7307> with him, and hath followed<WH310> me fully<WH4390>, him will I bring<WH935> into the land<WH776> whereinto he went<WH935>; and his seed<WH2233> shall possess<WH3423> it.

(Now the Amalekites<WH6003> and the Canaanites<WH3669> dwelt<WH3427> in the valley<WH6010>.) To morrow<WH4279> turn<WH6437> you, and get<WH5265> you into the wilderness<WH4057> by the way<WH1870> of the Red<WH5488> sea<WH3220>.
¶ And the LORD<WH3068> spake<WH1696> unto Moses<WH4872> and unto Aaron<WH175>, saying<WH559>,

How long shall I bear with this evil<WH7451> congregation<WH5712>, which murmur<WH3885> against me? I have heard<WH8085> the murmurings<WH8519> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, which they murmur<WH3885> against me.
Say<WH559> unto them, As truly as<WH3808> I live<WH2416>, saith<WH5002> the LORD<WH3068>, as ye have spoken<WH1696> in mine ears<WH241>, so will I do<WH6213> to you:

Your carcases<WH6297> shall fall<WH5307> in this wilderness<WH4057>; and all that were numbered<WH6485> of you, according to your whole number<WH4557>, from twenty<WH6242> years<WH8141> old<WH1121> and upward<WH4605>, which have murmured<WH3885> against me,

Doubtless ye shall not<WH518> come<WH935> into the land<WH776>, concerning which I sware<WH3027><WH5375> to make you dwell<WH7931> therein, save Caleb<WH3612> the son<WH1121> of Jephunneh<WH3312>, and Joshua<WH3091> the son<WH1121> of Nun<WH5126>.
But your little ones<WH2945>, which ye said<WH559> should be a prey<WH957>, them will I bring in<WH935>, and they shall know<WH3045> the land<WH776> which ye have despised<WH3988>.
But as for you, your carcases<WH6297>, they shall fall<WH5307> in this wilderness<WH4057>.

And your children<WH1121> shall wander<WH7462> in the wilderness<WH4057> forty<WH705> years<WH8141>, and bear<WH5375> your whoredoms<WH2184>, until your carcases<WH6297> be wasted<WH8552> in the wilderness<WH4057>.

After the number<WH4557> of the days<WH3117> in which ye searched<WH8446> the land<WH776>, even forty<WH705> days<WH3117>, each day<WH3117> for a year<WH8141><WH3117><WH8141>, shall ye bear<WH5375> your iniquities<WH5771>, even forty<WH705> years<WH8141>, and ye shall know<WH3045> my breach of promise<WH8569>.

I the LORD<WH3068> have said<WH1696>, I will surely<WH518><WH3808> do<WH6213> it<WH2063> unto all this evil<WH7451> congregation<WH5712>, that are gathered together<WH3259> against me: in this wilderness<WH4057> they shall be consumed<WH8552>, and there they shall die<WH4191>.

And the men<WH582>, which Moses<WH4872> sent<WH7971> to search<WH8446> the land<WH776>, who returned<WH7725>, and made all the congregation<WH5712> to murmur<WH3885><WH3885> against him, by bringing up<WH3318> a slander<WH1681> upon the land<WH776>,
Even those<WH582> men<WH582> that did bring up<WH3318> the evil<WH7451> report<WH1681> upon the land<WH776>, died<WH4191> by the plague<WH4046> before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068>.

But Joshua<WH3091> the son<WH1121> of Nun<WH5126>, and Caleb<WH3612> the son<WH1121> of Jephunneh<WH3312>, which were of the men<WH1992><WH582> that went<WH1980> to search<WH8446> the land<WH776>, lived<WH2421> still.
And Moses<WH4872> told<WH1696> these sayings<WH1697> unto all the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>: and the people<WH5971> mourned<WH56> greatly<WH3966>.

¶ And they rose up early<WH7925> in the morning<WH1242>, and gat them up<WH5927> into the top<WH7218> of the mountain<WH2022>, saying<WH559>, Lo<WH2009>, we be here, and will go up<WH5927> unto the place<WH4725> which the LORD<WH3068> hath promised<WH559>: for we have sinned<WH2398>.
And Moses<WH4872> said<WH559>, Wherefore now do ye transgress<WH5674> the commandment<WH6310> of the LORD<WH3068>? but it shall not prosper<WH6743>.
Go not up<WH5927>, for the LORD<WH3068> is not among<WH7130> you; that ye be not smitten<WH5062> before<WH6440> your enemies<WH341>.

For the Amalekites<WH6003> and the Canaanites<WH3669> are there before<WH6440> you, and ye shall fall<WH5307> by the sword<WH2719>: because ye are turned<WH7725> away<WH310> from the LORD<WH3068>, therefore the LORD<WH3068> will not be with you.

But they presumed<WH6075> to go up<WH5927> unto the hill<WH2022> top<WH7218>: nevertheless the ark<WH727> of the covenant<WH1285> of the LORD<WH3068>, and Moses<WH4872>, departed<WH4185> not out<WH7130> of the camp<WH4264>.
Then the Amalekites<WH6003> came down<WH3381>, and the Canaanites<WH3669> which dwelt<WH3427> in that hill<WH2022>, and smote<WH5221> them, and discomfited<WH3807> them, even unto Hormah<WH2767>.
